edu.internet2.hopi.dragon.dc
Class DCClient

java.lang.Object
  edu.internet2.hopi.dragon.dc.DCClient

public class DCClient
extends java.lang.Object

Class used to issue requests on behalf of the application to a DC server. An example request is one asking for a path between two endpoints. The client does not currently support the DC-to-DC requests that are used for path authorization.

Author:
Andrew Lake (alake@internet2.edu)

Constructor Summary
DCClient(java.lang.String host, int port)
          Constructor that accepts the hostname of the DC server and the TCP port number on which it is running
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.String getHost()
          Returns a string representation of the currently set host address of name that represents the location of the DC server
 int getPort()
          Returns the currently set remote TCP port number that will be used to contact the DC server

          Submits a request from the application to the DC server and returns the DC server's response.
 void setHost(java.lang.String host)
          Set IP Address or DNS name that represents the location of the DC server
 void setPort(int port)

Constructor Detail

DCClient

public DCClient(java.lang.String host,
                  int port)
Constructor that accepts the hostname of the DC server and the TCP port number on which it is running

Parameters:
host - A String representation of either an IP address or DNS name used to identify the DC server
port - The remote TCP port on which the DC server is running
Method Detail

sendRequest

public DCReply sendRequest(App2DCRequest request)
                      throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                             java.io.IOException
Submits a request from the application to the DC server and returns the DC server's response.

Parameters:
request - An object representation of the request parameters
Returns:
an DCReply object representation of the DC server's response
Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException - thrown when unable to connect to the DC server becaus ethe host is not recognized
java.io.IOException - thrown when there is an error reading or writing to the socket connected to the DC server

public java.lang.String getHost()
Returns a string representation of the currently set host address of name that represents the location of the DC server

Returns:
a string representation of the DC server host name or address

Returns the currently set remote TCP port number that will be used to contact the DC server

the currently set remote TCP port number that will be used to contact the DC server
